system.description: Almost as shady as the @L[Class:Assassin]{Assassin}, a Thief is a bit more socially oriented and has a much greater care for her own life. Thieves are the flip side of the Samurai and tend to follow laws and tell the truth only if it serves their purpose. Always trying to make a profit, thieves are the businessmen of the world and will cheat you without blinking an eyelash, that is their job. If you are playing a thief, lie and make up stories, be ever watchful for a chance to search or loot and look for the profit angle, never doing anything for free.

overview.base: You crawl at @L[Core:Movement Speed]{half speed} and can @L[Ability:Move]{Move} at @L[Core:Movement Speed]{half speed} speed while @L[Condition:Hidden]{hidden}. Additionally, @L[Category:Movement effects]{movement effects} only require a DC 10 @L[Core:SNK]{SNK} @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save} to keep from breaking your @L[Condition:Hidden]{hiding}.
overview.proficient: You crawl at @L[Core:Movement Speed]{full speed} and can @L[Ability:Move]{Move} at @L[Core:Movement Speed]{full speed} while @L[Condition:Hidden]{hidden}.

overview.base: @L[Category:Attack abilities]{Attacks} you make from @L[Condition:Hidden]{hiding} are @L[Keyword:Boosted]{boosted}. In addition, whenever you @L[Ability:Interact]{Interact} or @L[Ability:Unglue]{Unglue} as a @L[Category:Single action abilities]{single action} you may make trigger a @L[Ability:Basic Attack]{Basic Attack} or a second @L[Ability:Interact]{Interact} as a @L[Core:Reactive Maneuvers]{free reaction} as well.
overview.proficient: You may also trigger @L[Category:Single action abilities]{single action} @L[Category:Thief class abilities]{Thief abilities} as @L[Core:Reactive Maneuvers]{free reactions} in this way.

overview.base: Anything held in the targeted arm is knocked out of their hand. This triggers @L[Ability:Catch Item]{Catch Item}.

You are an @L[Keyword:Expertise]{expert} @L[Tradecraft:Courtier]{courtier} and @L[Tradecraft:Peacekeeper]{peacekeeper}. You also @L[Keyword:Resistance]{resist} @L[Category:Truth detecting effects]{truth detecting effects} and may give whichever response you like to them.
You are an @L[Keyword:Expertise]{expert} @L[Tradecraft:Locksmith]{locksmith}.
You catch the item. If multiple creatures are all trying to catch the same item, they all roll [[/roll 1d20 + @p]]. The creature with the highest roll catches the item.

system.trigger: An item within range is falling or flying by.
